member.remarks: Encryption: seed1 = *VALUE_TO_FIND* seed2 = 0xEEEEEEEEL seed2b = seed2 + cryptTable[0x400 + (seed1 and 0xFF)] encryptedByte1 = targetByte1 Xor (seed1 + seed2b) Decryption: Let s = encryptedByte1 xor targetByte1 Notice s = seed1 + seed2b Notice s = seed1 + seed2 + cryptTable[0x400 + (seed1 and 0xFF)] Let n = s - seed2 Notice n = seed1 + cryptTable[0x400 + (seed1 and 0xFF)] Notice seed1 = n - cryptTable[0x400 + (seed1 and 0xFF)] Notice the right side has only 256 possible values because seed1 is AND-ed with 0xFF Brute force seed1 by trying every possible value of (seed1 and 0xHFF) in the right side

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.PING
member.summary: Sent periodically by server to clients as a keep-alive packet. Clients should respond with an equivalent PONG. Clients which do not receive a PING or TICK for ~60s will disconnect. If the server does not receive PONG or GAME_TICK_GUEST from a client for ~60s, it will disconnect the client.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.GREET
member.summary: Sent by server in response to KNOCK to indicate the client has entered the game. This packet has two forms: one includes the data from the SLOT_LAYOUT packet, and the other doesn't.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.REJECT_ENTRY
member.summary: Sent by server in response to KNOCK to indicate the client did not enter the game.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.OTHER_PLAYER_JOINED
member.summary: Broadcast by server to other clients when a client enters the game.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.OTHER_PLAYER_LEFT
member.summary: Broadcast server to other clients when a client leaves the game.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.OTHER_PLAYER_READY
member.summary: Broadcast by server to all clients in response to a client sending READY. Clients start playing as soon as they have received this packet for each client.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.SLOT_LAYOUT
member.summary: Broadcast by server to all clients when the lobby state changes.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.START_COUNTDOWN
member.summary: Broadcast by server to all clients to start the countdown. Clients will disconnect if they receive this packet more than once. START_COUNTDOWN can be sent without sending START_LOADING afterwards (wc3 will wait at 0 seconds indefinitely).

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.START_LOADING
member.summary: Broadcast by server to all clients to tell them to start loading the map. Clients will disconnect if they receive this packet more than once. START_LOADING does not require START_COUNTDOWN to have been sent.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.TICK
member.summary:
Broadcast by server to all clients periodically during game play. Contains client actions received by the server, which will be applied at the current game time. Contains a timespan, in milliseconds, during which no more actions will be applied. - The client will run the game up to 'current game time + given timespan' before host-lag-pausing. - This is how synchronization and smooth progression of game time are achieved. Significantly altering the reported timespan to real time ratio can have weird effects, including game time stopping and losing apparent game time.
The sub packet format: 0 WORD truncated crc32 of following data 1 BYTE player index of sender 2 DWORD following size of subpacket 3 BYTE subpacket id ... [depends on subpacket] ...

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.TEXT
member.summary: Relayed by server to clients not connected directly to the sender. Different formats in game and in lobby. Clients will only request relay to clients who should receive the message (eg. only allies for ally chat).

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.KNOCK
member.summary: First thing sent by clients upon connection. Requests entry into the game.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.LEAVING
member.summary: Sent by clients before they intentionally disconnect.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.READY
member.summary: Sent by clients once they have finished loading the map and are ready to start playing.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.GAME_ACTION
member.summary: Sent by clients when they perform game actions such as orders, alliance changes, trigger events, etc. The server includes this data in its next TICK packet, broadcast to all the clients. Clients don't perform an action until it shows up in the TICK packet. If the TICK packet's actions disagree with the client's actions, the client will disconnect.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.TOCK
member.summary: Sent by clients in response to TICK. Contains a checksum of the client's game state, which is used to detect desyncs. The lag screen is shown if a client takes too long to send a response TOCK.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.LAN_REQUEST_GAME
member.summary: Response to LAN_REFRESH_GAME or LAN_CREATE_GAME when clients want to know game info.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.LAN_DESCRIBE_GAME
member.summary: Response to LAN_REQUEST_GAME containing detailed game information.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.LAN_CREATE_GAME
member.summary: Broadcast on lan when a game is created.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.LAN_REFRESH_GAME
member.summary: Broadcast on lan periodically to inform new listening wc3 clients a game exists. Contains only very basic information about the game [no map, name, etc].

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.LAN_DESTROY_GAME
member.summary: Broadcast on lan when a game is cancelled.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.PLAYERS_CONNECTED
member.summary: Sent by clients to the server to inform the server when the set of other clients they are interconnected with changes.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.MAP_INFO
member.summary: Sent by the server to new clients after they have entered the game. Contains information about the map they must have to play the game.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.UL_START
member.summary: Sent by the server to tell a client to start uploading to another client. DL_START must be sent to the other client for the transfer to work.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.DL_START
member.summary: Sent by the server to tell a client to start downloading the map from the server or from another client. UL_START must be sent to the other client for the p2p transfer to work.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.DL_STATE
member.summary: Sent by clients to the server in response to MAP_INFO and when the client has received more of the map file.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.DL_MAP_CHUNK
member.summary: Sent to to downloaders during map transfer. Contains map file data.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.DL_RECEIVED_CHUNK
member.summary: Positive response to DL_MAP_CHUNK.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.DL_CHUNK_PROBLEM
member.summary: Negative response to DL_MAP_CHUNK. This can be caused by corrupted data or by sending DL_MAP_CHUNK before DL_START is sent. Even though wc3 clients send this packet if data is sent before DL_START, they still accept and use the data.

member.name: F:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId.PONG
member.summary: Sent by clients in response to PING.

member.name: T:HostBot.Warcraft3.W3PacketId
member.summary: Identifies a warcraft 3 packet type.
member.data: 0 BYTE GAME_PACKET_PREFIX 1 BYTE packet type 2 WORD size including header = n 3 BYTE[4:n] data
